sentences.english: Scientists in the blimp did not see anything.
sentences.chinese: 小飛艇上的科學傢什麼也沒看見。

sentences.english: Germany used Zeppelins and other airships for military purposes.
sentences.chinese: 德國將齊伯林式飛艇和其它類型飛艇用於戰爭。

sentences.english: Germany used Zeppelins and other airships for military purposes.
sentences.chinese: 德國將齊伯林式飛艇和其它類型飛艇用於戰爭。

sentences.english: Zeppelins are giant flying airships that have traditionally been run by Goblins.
sentences.chinese: 地精飛艇是一種巨大的飛船，傳統上由地精們駕駛。

sentences.english: It had a metal skeleton and a series of gasbags inside an outer covering.
sentences.chinese: 這種飛艇在外包層裏面裝有一副金屬骨架和許多氣囊。

sentences.english: The advanced availability of an airship is strongly related with the performances of the envelope mare-rials (EM) used.
sentences.chinese: 飛艇的先進性無不和它所用囊體材料的性能息息相關。
最後，停止了飛艇的製造。

sentences.english: These are used by the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company.
sentences.chinese: 這些飛艇是固特異輪胎橡膠公司用來做廣告的。

sentences.english: The above definition would rule out unmanned dirigibles or airships.
sentences.chinese: 上述定義將排除無人飛船或飛艇。

sentences.english: Blimps, Mr Watts reckons, will help them sate that appetite.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲氣球飛艇將使空軍能充分滿足陸軍的胃口。

sentences.english: Some flew over the North Sea looking for enemy ships in the water.
sentences.chinese: 一些飛艇飛行在北海上空尋找水上的敵艦。

sentences.english: Airships developed from balloons, the first successful method of human flight.
sentences.chinese: 飛艇是從人類飛行的最初成果氣球發展而來的。

sentences.english: The Army airship Roma was built in Italy and was a "semi-rigid" design.
sentences.chinese: 美軍飛艇羅馬號是一艘半硬式飛艇，建於意大利。

sentences.english: The Army airship Roma was built in Italy and was a "semi-rigid" design.
sentences.chinese: 美軍飛艇羅馬號是一艘半硬式飛艇，建於意大利。

sentences.english: The movie shows Chaplin bringing down a German Zeppelin aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 這部電影展示了卓別林擊落了一架德國齊柏林飛艇。

definition: to catapult/to launch/to eject (from a plane)/to shoot

(martial arts) wind-and-fire wheel, weapon used in hand-to-hand fighting/(Daoism) a magical pair of wheels on which one can stand to ride at great speed, used by Nezha 哪吒[Ne2 zha5]/(fig.) never-ending treadmill

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zhong1 xin1
